channel.title: Desirable Revisions in 2012
channel.description:
I am interested in developing my own server over the course of a few months (way into mid 2013). I am an old school junkie myself, and had quit RS quite simply because I disliked the new graphics and animations that started to appear in 2008.
However, I must agree now that HD does look great with all the lighting and shading effects, but I have a thirst for simplicity in private servers, and the 317-474 era hits the spot.
Because I know so little about anything above the 474 revision, I guess I'm a little put off with trying to discover all the new aspects of anything above it. What I need is a little insight from the greatest RSPS community currently going; I want your vote on what you would rather play right now: truly old school (317-377 (2005-2006)), mid school (459-474 (2007)) or new school (484-700+ (2008-2012)).
I want to develop a server that is unique and fresh, but what good would that be if no one wants to play it? It would be great if you could comment or just simply vote on the poll as to which type of server you would play at this current time, so that I could get some sort of idea on what people want.
My niche is old school, but I am willing to learn, use and develop something great from a new school server [i]if[/i] I think the majority of potential players would play it.
Any thoughts or discussion on the subject would be great, thanks.

item.title: Desirable Revisions in 2012
item.dc:creator: @Broken_Britain Broken Britain
item.description:
@Broken_Britain wrote:

Thanks for the votes so far. Hopefully can get a few more.

Read full topic

item.title: Desirable Revisions in 2012
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

As long as the server is organized, unique, has little to no bugs, and has a stable staff system, I believe it would be desirable.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Broken_Britain wrote:

Thanks for the vote, I also agree with Summoning. I’ve no idea how it even works.

item.title: Desirable Revisions in 2012
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

478/479 were the best revisions of the game. After the grand exchange but before the removal of the wilderness and free trade, after the DFS, dark bow and god wars were released, but before summoning (I’m not a fan of the skill).

Sadly, there isn’t any traces of either of these caches so there’s no chance of making them. I would go with 474-484.

Read full topic

item.title: Desirable Revisions in 2012
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

How about you can trade it, but to wield it you need to kill 100 minions of gods other than the one you want to use. To use the Armadyl Godsword, you must kill 100 Zamorak, Saradomin or Bandos minions. When you’ve killed 100, you can wield it. Every 10 creatures you kill with the sword after this lowers it by 1, at 0 you must kill 100 again.

Read full topic

item.title: Desirable Revisions in 2012
item.dc:creator: @Broken_Britain Broken Britain
item.description:
@Broken_Britain wrote:

Of course, but without trade restrictions because you’re taking away the risk factor of losing it in the wilderness. The power:risk ratio would be completely unbalanced.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile

But if a player is good enough to use one, they should have to earn it

@Broken_Britain wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

I don’t like the 474 revision for godwars things, I like the 474 revision for the new quests that came out. The Fremenick Series and the Lunar spellbook came in that revision.

Lunars and neitiznot were in the 459 era so maybe you prefer that revision?

item.title: Desirable Revisions in 2012
item.dc:creator: @Broken_Britain Broken Britain
item.description:
@Broken_Britain wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:8, topic:462455”][quote author=Broken Britain link=topic=565624.msg4114346#msg4114346 date=1348880813]

This was the year of

[size=36pt]443[/size]

Frontier. What’s significant about that revision?
[/quote]

It was at the cusp of 2006-2007 (literally the client is from December of 2006). It has hunter, construction, but doesn’t have godwars.[/quote]
That’s quite the perfect number. It also means 443 won’t have the dragonfire shield though, which is one of the things I liked about the 459. Dfs but no godwars.

I think 443 is a great alternative to the 459 if you like old school, but not godwars, because if I’m correct Frontier is the only 443 released with player updating (or the only 443 released)? Makes it great for being unique from the beginning.

Thanks sini, good era.

runescape sucks:

I think god wars would be okay if it was harder to accesss

Making godwars a challenging aspect instead of just something else to do, I agree. Personally I dislike godswords because they are the foundation of overpowered weapons.

Regarding private servers, if they actually resembled some sort of rarity and “wow factor” about obtaining them, then they would be worthy of their power and much more appreciated.

Read full topic

item.title: Desirable Revisions in 2012
item.dc:creator: @Broken_Britain Broken Britain
item.description:
@Broken_Britain wrote:

Thanks for the reply.

I’m not necessarily talking about remakes, but just unique servers in general that have custom, yet balanced content. Economy servers that have the perfect balance of experience rates (challenging but not slow).

Thanks for the input though, from the two replies I can see that godswords are popular.

Although, I’d like to base my decision on around 100 votes of the poll (not sure if that’s ambitious).

Read full topic
